dialogues.text: Get out. Garrett clicks up the handle on his bag and heads for the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're here to learn. Anyone else have a problem with that? Good. So who has the answer to my question? Everyone looks down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nobody's read this book? It's on the syllabus.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (raising hand and answering) You never assigned it to us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, now I am. And we're having a quiz tomorrow. Panic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On the first hundred pages. PANDEMONIUM.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can't do that! I have band and jazz band tonight!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We haven't had homework all year!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey! Zip your shit! We've fallen behind, and honestly, your practice tests scores sucked balls -- which was embarrassing to me both on a personal level and as an educator.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Things are about to change. Recess is over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elizabeth reads To Kill a mockingbird and highlights like crazy. She stops, takes a hit from her bong, and continues. Her roommate, Kirk, enters through the front door, sipping from a Big Gulp.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you get my Cool Ranch? He tosses her a bag of chips.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You owe me two bucks.. Kirk walks into his room and closes the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elizabeth paces. She has a book of stickers in her hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, now, what is the significance of the Mockingbird in the novel? What was Harper Lee trying to tell us? No one raises their hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, you guys know this. This is as close to real teaching as we've seen from Elizabeth. Sasha raises her hand. We see that she already has two gold star stickers on her forehead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (rolls her eyes) Anyone else?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chase raises her hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a symbol for, um, equality? Elizabeth puts a sticker on Chase's forehead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, good. Can anyone add to what that girl said?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The desks have been arranged into a makeshift courtroom. Spencer presides as the judge. Chase and Shawn are the prosecutors. Garrett is dressed like Boo Radley. Tristan, the bully, addresses the rest of the class -- the "jury." Everyone is clearly into the exercise. REVEAL Principal Snur, clad in a dolphin tie, watching fr the back of the class.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ladies and Gentlemen of the jury, you've heard the "facts," but come on, you know me. I'm Atticus Finch, baby! The class laughs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, seriously. You're gonna side with Chase and Shawn over me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Use examples from the book.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It doesn't matter what race the defendant is. You've just gotta look at the facts-. Elizabeth nods in agreement. The bell RINGS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good work today. And don't forget to leave your closing statements on my desk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The students all dutifully drop off their papers, placing them in a neat stack next to other ungraded PAPERS. Principal Snur exits, giving Elizabeth a thumbs up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Love the tie!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scott and Amy share a bag of trail mix. Sandy reads a Jerry Garcia biography. Lynn grades. papers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, you know how I hate to gossip, but I heard that one of the custodians walked in on Omar -- you know, that Arabic boy -- giving...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oral sex to Matty Feldstein after swim practice in the boy's locker room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It just starts younger and younger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's nice to finally see the Jews and the Arabs getting along. Elizabeth enters. Scott looks up and smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Ms. Halsey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your shirt's mis-buttoned. Her shirt's mis-buttoned.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh shit. Hold on. Elizabeth turns away from them and starts rebuttoning. Sandy tries to sneak a peek. Scott shoots him a dirty look. Sandy gives an innocent shrug.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (grabs yogurt from fridge) I've just been such a mess the last few days. Working myself to the bone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, it's been quite a change. SCOTT. Well, I think it's great. Some teachers just sail by, doing the bare minimum. It's good to know there are still some actual educators out there. Elizabeth smiles for Scott, like, "You get me."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I should get going. Nice seeing all of you. Amy and Elizabeth smile thinly at one another. Elizabeth squeezes Scott's shoulder as she exits. Amy notices.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What a good egg.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Amy and Sasha sit in the empty auditorium. Sasha is dressed as LITTLE ORPHAN ANNIE, including the RED WIG." Student STAGEHANDS construct a set.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What else, Sasha?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know. I told you about the car wash money.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't prove that. What else?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think I've told you everything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And no more movies in class?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, we're actually learning. Did you know that Animal Farm isn't even really about animals --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Animal Farm?! That's not even on the syllabus!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (then, collecting herself) I know you're forgetting something. Do you want extra credit on your diorama or not?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want it! Let me think... Oh there was... never mind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was okay. It was medicinal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait. Hold your horses. What was medicinal?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ms. Halsey was smoking in her car, but she told me her doctor prescribed it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Holy guacamole.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SLO MO. Two scary-looking GERMAN SHEPHERDS, their teeth bared, pull two POLICE OFFICERS down the hall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to German Shepherd, coaxing) Come on, Axel, what do you smell, boy? The Police Officers continue the search. They lead the dogs up against lockers and knock on class doors. Amy and Principal Snur watch from the end of the hallway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You better be right about this -- or I'm going to be getting a lot of panicked calls from parents.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Trust me, Wally. My kids in D.A.R.E. tell me everything and there are drugs in this school. And not just the students. Some of the female teachers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The class is split up into mini-sections of four desks each. The students are quietly and dutifully working. As Elizabeth reads papers and grades them, we HEAR the various student's voices.

dialogues.speaker: TRISTAN, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Atticus Finch is a good lawer because he's a good person whose a layer. Elizabeth looks at Tristan. As she writes, we HEAR --

dialogues.speaker: ELIZABETH, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Proofread.

dialogues.speaker: JUMP CUT TO
dialogues.text: QUICK CUTS. Elizabeth grades another paper. She's growing more agitated and is now feverishly writing.

dialogues.speaker: ELIZABETH, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Wrong!!!

dialogues.speaker: ELIZABETH, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Is this English?

dialogues.speaker: ELIZABETH, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Are you fucking kidding me? Elizabeth crosses out with one line, so it's clearly visible beneath. From out in the hallway, we HEAR the loud, aggressive BARKING of the DOGS. Tristan runs to the door and peeks out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whoa. Drug dogs. Cool.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sit down. Elizabeth races to the window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Police officers and the dogs enter the classroom next to hers. Elizabeth glances back at her pocketbook.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (under her breath) Balls. She races back to her desk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Keep reading. Elizabeth takes her seat and leans under her desk, obscuring her from her class. She opens her pocketbook and pulls out a CIGARETTE CASE. She pops it open and we SEE three neatly rolled JOINTS. Without hesitation, Elizabeth POPS the first one into her mouth and starts chewing vigorously. As she. makes her way through the second and then the third, the chewing becomes slower and the BARKING becomes louder and louder. Elizabeth starts CHOKING as the door opens and the Police Officer and the German Shepherd enter, followed by Principal Snur and Amy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elizabeth, sorry to bother you. This will only take a second. Elizabeth,. still choking, digs into her purse. She grabs her cough syrup and takes a huge swig. Elizabeth wipes her mouth, breathes normally.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry. I had something caught in my throat. The German Shepherd continues barking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is it, Axel? Where is it, boy? The Dog comes bounding at Elizabeth. Elizabeth's eyes go wide. Amy licks her lips. The Dog sideswipes Elizabeth, almost knocking her over, and jumps onto Garrett.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ahhh!!! The'Police Officer starts rummaging through Garrett's bag and pulls out an opened bag of CORN CHIPS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (holding up Corn Chips) All clear. Dog must've responded to these. Happens. Elizabeth glares at Amy -- "I know you were behind this." Amy glares back. Principal Snur looks at Amy and shakes his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (grasping at straws, to Garrett) Even though that wasn't drugs, junk food is still contraband. That's detention, Buster.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Enough, Amy. I think it's time we call off this witch-hunt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pointedly to Amy) Thank you, Principal Snur. Now if you'll excuse me, my class has a state test to prepare for. Principal Snur, Amy and the Police Officer exit. Elizabeth slumps down into her chair, and all at once, the combination of WEED and COUGH SYRUP HITS HER.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whoa.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you okay, Ms. Halsey? Elizabeth takes a long beat before answering.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Class dismissed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But the bell didn't ring.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get out of my face. (then, to Garrett) And leave the corn chips. The class uncertainly gathers their things and heads out. From outside Elizabeth's window, we SEE the SCHOOL BUSSES idling curbside. Elizabeth stares at the papers she still needs to grade. The papers stare back at her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to no one) But first, a nap.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elizabeth is asleep at her desk. She wakes with a jolt. A paper is stuck to her face. She looks again at the stack of work, then at the pile of things she's already corrected. There's FOUR.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Balls! She knocks the stack of ungraded papers to the ground. After a beat, she collects herself, goes to pick the, papers off the floor. As she starts tossing them into the trash, something catches her eye: a PRACTICE TEST MANUAL. And in the corner, an address:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peoria Il, 61602

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Huh. Elizabeth tears off the corner and pockets it.

dialogues.speaker: ELIZABETH, (PRE-LAP)
dialogues.text: Hey, it's Elizabeth Halsey...

dialogues.speaker: I/E. ELIZABETH'S CAR
dialogues.text: Elizabeth is driving down the highway and smoking a joint

dialogues.speaker: ELIZABETH, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Unfortunately, I can't make it in today. My grandmother took a turn for the worse and it looks like she's dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The kids are laughing and engaged. TURN TO REVEAL SCOTT, dressed in overalls and a straw hat with a piece of hay in his mouth, animatedly teaching. He's holding a copy of "The Adventures of Tom Sawyer."

dialogues.speaker: ELIZABETH, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Yeah. So I'm off to the funeral. Wish me luck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elizabeth knocks on the door. A buff, shirtless guy in a backwards hat opens it. He likes what he sees.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is Tucker here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, hold on. T-baaaaag! Someone's here. (then, back to Elizabeth) So you coming to our "CEOs and Corporate Ho's" party tonight? Elizabeth just stares at the Frat Guy. He turns away. Tucker, dressed identically to the Frat Guy but twenty pounds overweight, hustles down the stairs. He has a tattoo of intertwined teabags around his bicep.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tucker sits on his bed. Elizabeth leans against a desk, unwilling to sit down on anything in his disgusting room. BOB MARLEY plays softly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you ever talk to my brother?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. He dumped me, remember?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You and my brother always had the histrionics.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, do you want to come to our party tonight? "CEOs and Corporate Ho's?" We're kinda light on Ho's.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like I told "Frat Guy #1," I'm not interested.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then what's up?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I need some date rape drugs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (hurt, defensive) Two things. Number one: who do you think I am? Yeah, I like to party and yeah, I'm in an awesome frat, but that really hurts. And two: they're not "date rape" drugs. It's called GHB -- and it's for weightlifting. It helps build mass, okay? Why do you even want it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For lifting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have money and I'm in a rush. She takes out a wad of cash.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's all you needed to say. No need to get all histrionic on me. Tucker walks over to a chest, opens it, and takes out a small lockbox. He unlocks it and takes out a small bottle containing a clear liquid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One capful makes you feel really good. Two capfuls will knock her out for a couple hours. You don't want to take any more than two. Elizabeth hands him some cash. He hands her the jar and then gives her a big, warm hug.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen, I know you and my brother aren't together anymore, but I still think of you as a sister, okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get your hand off my ass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry, didn't even know I put it down there. Good luck with your lifting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Elizabeth drives, we HEAR a phone RINGING.

dialogues.speaker: WOMAN'S VOICE, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: I.S.A.T. How can I direct your call?

dialogues.speaker: ELIZABETH, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: Hi, my name is Marjorie Goodman and I'm calling from the Chicago Tribune. Who could I speak to regarding allegations of racial bias on your standardized tests? A beat.

dialogues.speaker: WOMAN'S VOICE, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: Please hold.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A portly, unkempt man in a cheap suit, CARL HALABI, nervously walks through the hotel bar. He sees the back of a WOMAN with a RED PERM.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marjorie? "Marjorie" turns and we SEE that it's actually ELIZABETH, wearing the "Little Orphan Annie" wig. She's sipping a cocktail.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You must be Carl. His face lights up, excited to be in the company of such an attractive woman. Elizabeth stands and extends her hand. Carl notices Elizabeth's very short skirt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks for meeting me on such short notice. Elizabeth motions for him to sit down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You find the place alright? Good drive?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Great drive. I love downstate Illinois.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: First time to Peoria?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hmm mmm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A lot of people don't know this, but it's the largest city on the Illinois River.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wow. I did not know that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yup yup. And it was actually founded before Chicago.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello, Jeopardy! Have you ever auditioned?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (enjoying the compliment) No. I should, I should. Definitely thought about it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen, I'd love to sit here and chat with you all night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But I'm sure you're a very busy man, so I'll get right down to it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've spoken to various, um, black citizens who are alleging that your tests are biased towards white people and Orientals.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shakes head in frustration) You can't use my name, okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No problem.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like I told you on the phone, every couple of years, we get calls from all over the state with these cockamamie charges. You should hear what they call me. And I'm not a racist. I voted for Obama. (motioning for her to write) That, you can quote me on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, right. Elizabeth takes out a notebook and pen and starts jotting down notes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, Marjorie, I know my tests aren't perfect. But what's the alternative? I'm all for free thinking and creativity, but how do you formulate an education budget without hard numbers from one of my tests?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't need to convince me. But you know what would help, Carl? For me to see one of this year's tests.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No problem at all. Elizabeth lights up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll send you one the day after the schools administer them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd really love to see it sooner. I'm on a bit of a deadline.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wish I could, but unfortunately, you need one of these bad boys. Carl holds up a lanyard with a STATE ID CARD and some keys attached.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ooh, you look like you're CIA. Listen, I totally get it. Enough business for one night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm gonna have another drink before I hit the road. What's your poison?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My poison is the white devil. Wine. White wine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fantastic. (then, to Bartender) One white wine, one tequila sunrise, and two shots of tequila.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl is a little tipsy and slurring his words. Elizabeth seems to be fine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know, Marjorie, this is the best night I've had in a longtime.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, that makes two of us. Elizabeth gives Carl "fuck me" eyes. He nervously sips his drink.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What turns you on, Carl?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know what turns me on, Carl? He giggles nervously.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sex in an office. Getting fucked really, really hard against a wooden desk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mine's metal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Even better.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl flips on the fluorescent lights and they flicker on, like dominoes across the ceiling. They enter his office and Carl awkwardly leans against the metal desk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (gesturing, as promised) So this is the desk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you have anything to drink? Carl goes to a mini-fridge and pulls out an already opened bottle of white wine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: White wine in the office. You're a bad boy. Carl pours a glass. Elizabeth swigs from the bottle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you have any music?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Um... I could put on some internet radio. Carl goes to fiddle with his computer. Elizabeth quickly reaches into her purse and pulls out the bottle of GHB. She pours a little into Carl's wine. And then a little bit more. As he turns around, she hands him the glass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A toast. To new friends.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To new lovers. CLINK. Carl downs his glass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm gonna take off my shoes. Is that okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whatever, man. I'm gonna hit the lady's room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: K, first door on your right. Don't be long. Carl starts carefully clearing everything off of his desk

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elizabeth waits in the bathroom. Yawns. Checks her watch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She walks back in. Carl looks woozy. The only thing keeping him from passing out is the prospect of seeing Elizabeth naked.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wanna fug ya agains dis desk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Easy, Cowboy. Carl stumbles towards her. Elizabeth deftly moves around the desk and exits into the bullpen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marblorie!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (as to a child) Carl, I'm gonna need you to pass the fuck out. Carl smiles as he feebly chases after her. He. stops at the photocopier, steadies himself momentarily and then passes out, STILL STANDING. Elizabeth grabs the lanyard from Carl's neck and heads ba into his office. She goes over to the filing cabinets, unlocks it with one of the keys, and starts rifling. She pulls out a folder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And bingo was his name-o. She walks over to the photocopier and pushes Carl over. H collapses on the ground -- out cold. She copies the test puts it back and grabs a stack of scantrons from a shelf. She takes a post-it, scribbles something and sticks it to his forehead. As Elizabeth exits, the camera PUSHES IN: "You were AMAZING. Love, Marjorie."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elizabeth stares at the clock. 8:59... 8:59.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, go. The students open their test books and start. Twenty- five pencils hit paper in unison.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elizabeth stares at the clock. 10:59... 10:59.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, pencils down. A couple of groans. A couple of frantic moves to fill in more scantron bubbles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, come on. It doesn't even matter. Bring your tests up. The students dutifully place their tests into a neat stack on the corner of Elizabeth's desk and exit. Elizabeth waits for all the kids to leave and then slides all of the exams into the trash. She pulls out a match and lights the exams on fire. She then reaches into her bag and pulls out a new stack of completed exams. She places the new exams into an official-looking folder and exits.

dialogues.speaker: CHYRON
dialogues.text: Principal Snur is on stage. All the teachers sit in the first few rows. Amy stands at her seat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If anyone has any information regarding the whereabouts of the missing "Annie" wig, please let me know ASAP. Because if that wig isn't found, you can bet your bottom dollar the "sun will not come out tomorrow." Back to you, Wally. Amy sits. Principal Snur addresses the teachers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks, Amy. Um, okay, I'm sure everyone wants to go home, so I'll be quick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fourscore and seven years ago... Scattered laughter. Elizabeth rolls her eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (holding up file) So I have here the results of the state exam -- and I'm happy to announce that John Adams Middle School had the fifth highest scores in the state. The Teachers applaud.

dialogues.speaker: PRINCIPAL SNUR, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: And I want to single out one of our own, who showed that with hard work and dedication, one person can make a difference. She makes me proud to be her boss and she's now $5700 richer. With the highest scores in the county -- yes, you heard me right, in the county ---I want everyone to please give a hand to --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to random teacher) Oh boy, third year in a row. This is starting to get embarrassing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elizabeth Halsey! Elizabeth leans over to Amy, who's sitting beside her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is unexpected. All of the color drains from Amy's face as Elizabeth stands and waves at the crowd.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Teachers are exiting the auditorium. Scott catches up to Elizabeth, who's marvelling at the bonus check.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, if it isn't Professor Smartypants. Scott playfully punches her shoulder. Elizabeth playfully punches him back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Better not mess with me. I'm a lot stronger than I look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So what are you gonna do with your new- found riches?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Something big. Maybe two big things. Amy walks up and gives Elizabeth a big, fake hug.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey! Ism so proud of you. If someone told me at the beginning of the year that you -- you! -- would get the bonus, I would've said to whomever it was, 'you must be joshing me.' And now, here we are. Here we are.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We should go out and celebrate. (joking, to Elizabeth) Your treat?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What a good, fun idea. Unfortunately, Scott and I have to go over the itinerary for the D.C. trip. We're the chaperones. We're going together. (then, quiet to Elizabeth) We're dating, so it'll also be romantic. You're not dating anyone now, right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've got my eye on someone, but he's dating a major cunt. (then, to Scott) Pardon my French.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, she sounds terrible.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well then. Scott, we should skedaddle. Those itineraries won't schedule themselves. Amy and Scott head off. Scott turns around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rain check on those drinks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can bet on it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Danni, the receptionist, uncrumples a BALL OF CRUMPLED CA and counts it. Elizabeth taps her fingers impatiently.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Almost done. We don't normally deal with cash here. At the doctor's office. Elizabeth slides the bonus check across the desk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And this is endorsed. And the rest you can put on these. Elizabeth slides four credit cards across the desk. The MIDDLE-AGED DOCTOR from earlier walks by.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And when would you like to come in?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi. He goes into his office. Elizabeth turns back to Danni.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And when would you like to come in?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Today. Tomorrow. As soon as possible. Danni checks her calendar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A week from tomorrow, then?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Book it. Danni slides Elizabeth a packet of literature.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We have a 48 hour cancellation policy. Anything after that, you'll be charged 50% the cost of the surgery -- unless there are extenuating circumstances.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wouldn't miss it for the world. Elizabeth pulls her shirt away from her body and looks down at her breasts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So long, suckers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The lot is empty except for Elizabeth's car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elizabeth enters and pulls latex gloves from her bag. She snaps them on. She takes a seat at Amy's desk and pulls an apple from her bag. Then she pulls out POISON IVY. She rubs the apple with the poison ivy leaves and then carefully places it in the center of the desk. Elizabeth smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Amy's class is seated. Amy enters and heads for her desk. She notices the apple and smiles at her class, touched. Thank you. The class stares back at her blankly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who did this? No response from the class.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh come on. Nobody wants an extra sticker on their all-star board? Amy presses the apple to her ear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (muppet voice, to apple) Who brought you to me? Amy places the apple up to her ear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's that, Mr. Apple? You want me to take a bite? Alrighty-roo. Amy takes a bite of the apple and then addresses the clas

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Enough horsin' around, let's get started.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A LUXURY BUS idles curbside. Parents see off their kids. Scott and Elizabeth are checking kids in. Principal Snur walks up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All set?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think we're good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elizabeth, thanks again for hopping in last minute. You really saved us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is Amy going to be okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She'll be fine. But to be honest, I think she was scaring some of the kids.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I bet, I bet. Well, let her know she's in my thoughts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Amy watching from outside her car. One side of her face is completely blistered, scaly and red from the POISON IVY. The kids have every reason to be scared by her. She gets into her car and slams the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (banging on steering wheel) Fudge! Fudge! Fudge! Fuuuuuck--dge!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kids sing BUS SONGS. Elizabeth and Scott sit up front.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Sasha! Hey, Sasha!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think I hear it again!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're wanted on the telephone!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If it's not Chase, then I'm not home! Chase rolls her eyes. Up front, Scott and Elizabeth sit next to one another and share ipod buds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (nodding to the beat) You guys are amazing. Period 5 is definitely going to make it. Scott smiles wide. Garrett walks up the aisle. He looks at Elizabeth, then turns to Scott.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Delacourte, do you think we could go to the poetry museum?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, um, I don't know, Champ, um -- Scott looks to Elizabeth, like "please help."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Garrett, supersweet) Oh, honey, I bet everyone would just love to walk around and look at all the poetry on the walls, but unfortunately, the itinerary's really tight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why are you talking like that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just go sit down, sweetie. Garrett gives her an annoyed look and then heads back to his seat. Scott smiles at Elizabeth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wow, you are such a natural.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When you love what you do, it comes easy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A splotchy-faced Amy trudges down the hallway. She passes Elizabeth's room, stops, walks back to the door and peers in. She looks down the hallway -- it's empty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Amy rifles through Elizabeth's desk. She opens the top drawer. Just pens and paper. She tries the bottom drawer. Locked. Shishkebabs!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Amy drags ELIZABETH'S DESK across the hallway into her room. It's a slow, difficult and loud process.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Amy, sweating, now drags HER OWN DESK across the.hallway into Elizabeth's room. She stops to catch her breath.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Amy watches as the MAINTENANCE GUY sorts through his keys and tries to unlocks the desk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (nervous, too loud) I never lose my keys!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's wrong with your face?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's wrong with your face?!?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just making conversation. He finds the right key and opens the desk.

dialogues.speaker: MAINTENANCE GUY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: All set.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (buying it back) Super! Thanks a bunch, Amos! The Maintenance Man exits. Amy immediately opens the desk and rummages through it. She pulls out the "Annie" wig.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Busted. She pulls out a test booklet. There's a piece ripped out from the front page. Amy's eyes narrow. She runs to the floor, where she has neat stacks of what used to be in her desk. She finds her test booklet and compares the two, clocking the I.S.A.T. address.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Looks like somebody's in big, big trouble.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To establish.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elizabeth and Scott stand with the kids in the lobby area

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alright, guys, count-off. The students begin their count-off.
He bumps knuckles with his friend.
As the students continue counting off, we

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: D.C. Montage: --Elizabeth and Scott walk with the kids through ARLINGTON NATIONAL CEMETERY. Elizabeth snaps her gum. --Elizabeth, Scott and the kids follow a TOUR GUIDE through the WHITE HOUSE. Elizabeth takes the gum from her mouth and looks for a place to toss it. She doesn't see a trash can and quickly sticks it to the bottom of an antique table. --Chase has Elizabeth take a "Charlie's Angels" posed picture of her and her minions. Elizabeth takes the pictu before they're fully posed and hands the camera back. END MONTAGE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Amy, her face still covered in the rash, sits across from Carl Halabi, the administrator that Elizabeth roofied. Carl is staring at a photo of Elizabeth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She changed her hair. Is Marjorie in some kind of trouble?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think you're the one that might be in some kind of trouble! Did you or did you not give her a copy of the state test?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?! No!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All I did was give her a couple of quotes ,for her article and that's it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What article?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For the Tribune. She's a reporter there. Right? Amy's eyes go wide.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Amy's car ZOOMS past the camera.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Amy's drives, her hands at 10 and 2. CLOSE ON the speedometer as the needle hovers between 55 and 56 mph.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The students take pictures. Garrett walks up to chase.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, you want me to take your picture?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alright, well let me know. I've got my camera and my battery's fully charged. She turns away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Awesome.
.Scott, who stares up at the memorial and looks choked up Elizabeth walks up behind him eating a fruit roll-up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fruit roll-up?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm so conflicted about this man. Did you know that he had slaves? Elizabeth tries to dislodge a piece of the fruit roll-up from the back of her mouth with her tongue.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, everyone knows that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just hate slavery so, so much. An unquestionable evil. I hate it. Elizabeth continues struggling with the fruit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Slavery's the worst.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If I could go back in time and undo slavery, I would. Elizabeth gives him a sideways glance, like "no shit."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You really hate slavery, huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I hate it. Elizabeth finally dislodges the chunk of fruit roll-up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (re fruit roll-up) Got it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (staring straight ahead) You get it. Scott squeezes Elizabeth's shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks for listening.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, I want you to know you can talk to me about anything. Slavery, the Holocaust, relationships. Scott smiles. Elizabeth smiles. They lock eyes -- a moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Principal Snur squeezes a dolphin-shaped stress ball that chirps like a dolphin with every squeeze. Amy sits across from him, trying to contain her glee.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shaking his head) Test-tampering. Here? At J.A.M.S.?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And like I said, she stole the wig. I think we're dealing with a criminal master-mind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry to be the bearer of bad news, Wally. You know how much we all like her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know. It's a tragedy. But Amy, let's keep this between us. The last thing we need is a scandal on our hands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You betcha. (gets up to go, turns) You know what scares me the most? This is just what we know. This could be the tip of the iceberg. Who knows what else she's capable of?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The CAMERA is tight on a hotel room door. The faint thumping of hotel sex can be heard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elizabeth and Scott are dry-humping, FULLY CLOTHED except for their shoes and socks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh my gosh, your body feels so good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harder, harder. Elizabeth tries pulling off her shirt. Scott pulls it back down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh my gosh, I'm dry-humping the shit out of you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Erg. Dry fuck the fuck out of me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh my gosh, I'm so close... I'm... pfft. Ugh. Scott rolls off of Elizabeth and exhales deeply. There's a wet spot on his jeans.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That was a mistake.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That was fast.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know, I'm sorry. But this isn't me. And I. know this isn't you. I'm in love with Amy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But we're so good together. We both hate slavery, we both love teaching. And call me crazy, but I always imagined us spending summers at your family's compound in Hyannisport.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know. And you're awesome and you have a huge heart and I love your empathy. It's just, when I was dry-humping you, I couldn't stop thinking about dry-humping Any.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's because of my tits, isn't it? Well, I'm getting new ones in, like, two days. Don't make a decision until you see them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elizabeth, I think you're beautiful just the way you are, even with your flat chest. And I think Amy's beautiful. But I just have to do what's right. I made Amy a promise.
Scott holds up his hand, showing off a PROMISE RING.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What're you -- 13? Elizabeth angrily gets up and pulls on her socks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait, Elizabeth. Don't go. Spend the night here with me. You can sleep on the other bed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ooh, like a slumber party? I'm leaving. And for the record, your band sucks, asstard. Elizabeth opens the room door and exits. She tries slammi the door, but it's on a spring so it closes very, very sl

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The kids listen to a TOUR GUIDE on the steps of the memorial. Garrett sneaks furtive glances at Chase. Elizabeth stands away from the group, on her cell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wally. Why would I cheat? If I'm guilty of anything, it's teaching too hard. Great... I've got nothing to hide. She ends the call.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck! Scott, wearing a Thomas Jefferson souvenir T-shirt, and all of the students look over at Elizabeth.

dialogues.speaker: ELIZABETH., (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What?! The Tour Guide looks around uncertainly before continuing

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And does anyone know what Abraham Lincoln's nickname was? Sasha's hand shoots up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Honest Abe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Honest Abe", that's right. Because Lincoln always said what was on his mind, even if that meant being unpopular. Abraham Lincoln always showed great courage. Garrett takes this in. He looks over at Chase and then, after a beat, raises his hand.

dialogues.speaker: TOUR GUIDE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Yes?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I love Chase Streeter-Rossi. All eyes turn to Garrett. Chase looks mortified.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay then. Any other questions?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (presses, turns to Chase) I love you, Chase. I've always loved you. And even though you pretty much stopped talking to me in fifth grade, I don't care. I remember the Chase that wrote me a card when my dad was overweight and had to go to the hospital because of his heart --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That was from the whole class.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shut up, Sasha, I'm talking about a different card.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And then, a year later, when he left my mom and moved in with his trainer, you wrote me another card. What happened to us? Remember when we had a sleepover in the second grade and you wet your bed and you were so embarrassed and you made me promise not to ever tell anyone. Well, I never did and I never will. I know we're really young, but remember Romeo and Juliet were only 13. A lot of people don't know that. So there it is. My heart on a sleeve. (goes into rhyming verse) Don't let me leave / Always believe / A beat. Chase stares at Garrett.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gross. Chase's friends all start laughing. The rest of the class joins in. Garrett runs down the steps, away from everyone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alright, guys, let's settle down. The Tour Guide looks around, uncertain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And these columns here are Doric columns. Now let's move inside to see the interior murals painted by Jules Guerin. The Tour Guide leads the group inside. Elizabeth looks back and sees Garrett on the steps, his head in his hands. She rolls her eyes and walks down to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Abe Lincoln, get up. Tour's not over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She just laughed at me. Called me gross.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'll get over it. Get up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not going back. Leave me alone!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No! Garrett runs off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, come back here you little -- Elizabeth starts running after him in heels. She immediately breaks a heel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She breaks the other heel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fucker.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The students stand by their bus. Scott addresses them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who had a good time in D.C.? The students let out a cheer. SCOTT (cont'd) (CONT'D) Who ate too many french fries at lunch? The students let out another cheer. SCOTT (cont'd) (CONT'D) Alright, let's do our final count-off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A beat.

dialogues.speaker: ,SCOTT
dialogues.text: Wait, wait. Where's 5? Who's 5? Everyone looks around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think it's Garrett Tiara.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Garrett! Garrett! Nothing. Scott looks around, stricken.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SCOTT (cont'd) (CONT'D) And where's Ms. Halsey? Nothing. SCOTT (cont'd) (CONT'D) Alright, everyone on the bus!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elizabeth searches for Garrett.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Garrett! Garrett! Her cell phone RINGS. She checks the caller ID: "HOT SCOTT." She puts the phone back in her purse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The kids are getting restless. A lot of singing. A lot of horsing around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's go home! Let's go home! Scott sits up front by the driver. He's on his cell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm freaking out here. They've been missing over two hours. I'm just a substitute! (then, to kids) Shut up!!! The chanting immediately stops.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Amy, the phone cradled to her ear, leans back on her couch. She's wearing splotches of calamine lotion over her rash and her hair is pulled back. A TURTLE plods across her kitchen table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh my gosh. We just might have a Mary Kay Letourneau situation on our hands. Amy scratches the turtle's neck as it continues across the table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know. You think?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know. The woman's a criminal mastermind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is such a mess.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What I need from you is to focus and get our kids home safe. I'll take care of everything here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks, Amy. You're a lifesaver.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's what I do. Love you, Scooter. She hangs up the phone and cockily kicks her feet onto the table, accidentally knocking the turtle to the floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh boy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're no longer in the tourist areas. A STRAY DOG walks down the middle of the street. SIRENS WAIL. PROSTITUTES hail Johns with catcalls. Elizabeth, still in her broken heels, walks down the gritty street. -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Garrett! Garrett! Her phone RINGS. She checks the CALLER ID -- "HOT SCOTT."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm looking for him! Stop fucking calling me!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She powers her phone off and continues down the street. She passes two PROSTITUTES.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, guys. Hi. I'm looking for a young kid, about 13. Really annoying, kind of a cry baby. Have you seen him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fantastic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You best step off, bitch, because this is my block. This here's Poetry's block.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Poetry?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cause that's how she fuck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I fuck like that. Lyrical. Something occurs to Elizabeth. She smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you, Poetry. And Poetry's friend. Elizabeth walks off and sticks out her hand, trying to hail a cab. She passes a bunch of HOMELESS MEN warming up by a trash can fire.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Won't get a cab in this neighborhood. A CAR slows next to Elizabeth. A JOHN rolls down the passenger window and leans out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, sweetheart. How much for a titty fuck?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I need a ride.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh yeah, I need a ride, too. Right through those titties.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I need a ride. Like you driving, and me pointing mace at your face. I'll give you ten bucks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is weird. Twenty. Elizabeth hops in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MIDNIGHT. PARENTS are waiting. A few console Garrett's mom, Melody. A few LOCAL NEWS VANS idle nearby.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's gonna be alright. The police will find him. I'm sure they're back at the hotel. Probably just a mix-up. The bus pulls up to the curb and stops. Scott steps off first, clearly confused by the crowd and TV cameras. Immediately, a reporter thrusts a mic into his face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What can you. tell us about the alleged romance between Elizabeth Halsey and a 13 year old student?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? The students step off and the Parents swarm them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh baby, are you okay? Did she touch you? Sasha's parents engulf her in a hug.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh Sasha! (then, to Sasha's Dad) You expect this stuff to happen in Florida, not here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Garrett walks up to a drab building where he sees Elizabeth on the curb waiting for him. There's a tiny sign that reads "Office of the Poet Laureate."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's closed. Won't be open till morning. Come on. Let's get back to the hotel. I'm sure everyone's mad at you. Garrett stands his ground.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not leaving without talking to the poet laureate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you think that some Shel Silverstein wannabe is going to tell you the meaning of life?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you care?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm here, right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have to be here. You're a teacher.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not for long. I'm getting fired for cheating as soon as we get back. Garrett takes a seat next to Elizabeth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So. you came looking for me on your own?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yup. (holds up her shoes) And you owe me a new pair of Nanette Lepores.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just want to know what to say to Chase to get her to like me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know what you should do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just go out and sleep with as many girls, as you possibly can. Get her out of your head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They'll probably reject me, too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, probably. But life's about how you deal with rejection. You can either hide in a corner and cry or you can get stronger every time. And I figure a kid like you with not much going for him -- if he were to choose the latter -- might end up becoming a pretty strong man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now come on, let's get out of here. I'm freezing and Mr. Delacourte's probably shitting a brick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't go back there. All the kids will laugh at me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You seriously think they haven't been laughing already?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe Chase is wondering where I am.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hate to break it to you, kid, but I don't think anyone gives two shits where we are.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Principal.Snur sits across from Garrett's mother, Melody, who is beside herself. She is wearing a beret. A DETECTIVE and Amy are standing behind the desk. Principal Snur passes her a dolphin-shaped tissue box.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What else can you tell us about Garrett and Ms. Halsey's relationship?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was strictly student/teacher. Garrett's a gifted poet and Ms. Halsey was trying to bring that out of him. Amy snorts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did they ever spend time outside of the classroom?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aside from Christmas at our house? Absolutely not. The Detective glances at the Principal, like "Oh boy."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She used to give all the guys that look. That sex look. You know -- Amy gives her version of a sexy look to the Detective.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's a monster.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mrs. Tiara, I think we might need to consider the possibility that Elizabeth Halsey has abducted your son and that the two of them are involved in a sexual relationship.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marbles doesn't even have armpit hair!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (quietly, to Principal Snur) We should send out an Amber Alert. We need to catch this Sicko.

dialogues.speaker: TV NEWS FOOTAGE
dialogues.text: A REPORTER talks to camera on the steps of J.A.M.S. Other NEWS CREWS are in the bg.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A school official close to the scandal confirms that in addition to her alleged sexual relationship with the unnamed seventh grader, Elizabeth Halsey has been investigated for possible drug use, standardized testing fraud, and the theft of an "Annie" wig from a school production. The TV Report flashes an unflattering photo of ELIZABETH with a BLURRED OUT GARRETT. In front of the school, the Reporter turns to Principal S

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can you comment on any of these allegations?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The superintendent will speak to the press shortly, but for now, I'd just like to say that I hope Ms. Halsey does the right thing and brings back our student.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elizabeth buys two tickets. Garrett hovers beside her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're paying me back for this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elizabeth's ex-fiance, mark, stands with Sheila and talks to a REPORTER.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Am I shocked? Mark starts laughing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She was always very cold to me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chase is crying as she speaks to a DIFFERENT REPORTER.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (wiping away tears) Garrett sat diagonal from me in language arts. He was always so supportive of my modelling career.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lynn stands with a DIFFERENT REPORTER.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's my best friend. She tells me everything. We have lunch together!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tristan stands with a DIFFERENT REPORTER.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've been telling him to hit that all year. That's my boy!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Amy talks to a DIFFERENT REPORTER.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (holding a candle) "No child left behind." How ironic. That a child was left behind. In Washington, D.C. With a statutory rapist.

dialogues.speaker: INT. AMTRAK TRAIN NIGHT
dialogues.text: Elizabeth and Garrett are seated next to one another on the darkened train. Garrett's asleep against the window, Elizabeth is reading "In Style" with the overhead light. Garrett stirs, rolls the other way and gently places his head on Elizabeth's shoulder. She looks at him and then shrugs her shoulder to get him off. His head falls back on. She leaves it.

dialogues.speaker: I/E. TAXI
dialogues.text: Elizabeth is asleep on Garrett's shoulder. Garrett is pressed against the window, clearly uncomfortable. The Taxi turns a corner and Garrett notices something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, there's a bunch of people outside of my house. Elizabeth wakes up and looks up to see: A CANDLELIGHT VIGIL, including Amy, Scott, Melody, and many. of Garrett's classmates; a SEA OF TV CAMERAS; and TWO POLICE CARS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the fuck? (then, to Garrett) Did you steal something? The taxi pulls up to the curb and Elizabeth and Garrett . CHAOS. They're immediately swarmed by everyone. The Cops struggle to push past.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marbles!!! The reporters thrust mics in her face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How long have you been Why did you steal the sleeping together? "Annie" wig?!

dialogues.speaker: ELIZABETH ,
dialogues.text: Just the once on the train. What?! The Cops get through and smother Garrett in a police blanket. A FEMALE COP roughly leads Elizabeth to one of the squad cars.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is crazy! He's a kid. Elizabeth is put into the back of squad car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm a good person! I don't fuck minors! Elizabeth bangs on the window. Amy smiles and waves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A Sergeant is leading Elizabeth to a phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're quite the celebrity.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You want an autograph?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You get one call. Elizabeth picks up the phone. The Sergeant gives her some space.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi, this is Elizabeth Halsey calling. I'm calling to cancel my surgery for tomorrow. Extenuating circumstances. Please, please don't make me lose my deposit. Elizabeth slams down the receiver.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you need medical attention, we're required to provide it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just take me back to my cell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Silence. Elizabeth and her roommate, Kirk, who's now dressed in an ill-fitting suit and has his hair combed, sit across from Principal Snur and the SCHOOL SUPERINTENDENT, a no- nonsense woman in her 60s.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Again, speaking on behalf of the whole administration, I just want to apologize for what happened. Clearly, there was a miscommunication.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, you think? Kirk puts his hand up to Elizabeth, like "I'll take care of this."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My client has been an upstanding member of society her entire life. She has spent time as an educator, she has

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: More than once!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And she has touched the lives of those around her -- until last night. Elizabeth pulls Kirk into a lawyer/client huddle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You kind of sound like a pro.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you think they're going to find out that I didn't pass the bar?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're doing great. They break from their huddle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your administration jumped to conclusions, set off a media fire-storm and has humiliated one of its own. As Ms. .Halsey's chief counsel, I've advised her that we have an extremely strong case of libel and that it's certainly within her province to sue the district.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How do we make this go away?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ms. Halsey is not a litigious woman. She wants this whole matter to go away as quickly and painlessly as possible. Kirk slides a piece of paper across the desk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is a list of our demands. The Superintendent and Principal Snur scan the list.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're kidding me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't answer right now. Let it marinate. Oh, and I should mention that if this goes to trial, I can cry on cue. Elizabeth starts crying. Everybody looks at her, aghast. And as quickly she started, she stops.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now, if you'll all excuse me, I should be heading to fifth period. I hate to be tardy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elizabeth heads down the empty hallway. From the auditori the faint sound of "Tomorrow, Tomorrow" from "Annie" can heard. Amy steps out of the auditorium, humming along to the son She notices Elizabeth coming to her. Amy debates her opti

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elizabeth! I was so worried. You gave us quite a scare, you did. Elizabeth doesn't acknowledge her and continues walking toward Amy, only feet away now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (attempting some levity) Somebody's being a grumple-- BAM! Elizabeth punches Amy square in the nose. Amy drops to her knees and grabs her nose, now squirting blood.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elizabeth keeps walking and turns a corner. A BELL RINGS and the hallway starts filling with STUDENTS.

dialogues.speaker: PRINCIPAL SNUR, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Well, it's been another great year at JAMS...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: QUICK CUTS. The year is winding down. Instead of gym, kids are using the time to sign each other's yearbooks. Chase walks up to Garrett with her yearbook, asks him to sign it.

dialogues.speaker: PRINCIPAL SNUR, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Who can forget the exciting addition of a climbing wall to the small gym...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: QUICK CUTS. It's class photo day. With each FLASH, we SEE a different TEACHER with a different CLASS. And finally AMY, with a bandage over her nose and two black eyes, smiles widely alongside her CLASS.

dialogues.speaker: PRINCIPAL SNUR, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: .Or the student/teacher spelling bee.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Much like the first scene of the movie. The teachers are sipping plastic flutes of Champagne. Principal Snur is up front. Elizabeth lingers in the back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think that was a huge s-u-c-c-a-s-s. Polite laughter.

dialogues.speaker: PRINCIPAL SNUR, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: But seriously... With summer around the corner, it's time to not only say goodbye to another school year, but to also say goodbye to one of our own. Elizabeth smiles.

dialogues.speaker: PRINCIPAL SNUR, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Amy Squirrel. Amy, her face completely healed, steps forward, with a pursed smile.

dialogues.speaker: PRINCIPAL SNUR, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: After six short years of outstanding, tireless work here, Amy is transferring out of the district.

dialogues.speaker: PRINCIPAL SNUR, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I know she'll bring her love for learning to her new students. Sandy, the ponytailed teacher, pipes up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Speech! Speech!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Although leaving was a difficult choice... Amy looks over to Elizabeth, who motions for her to continue.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When the superintendent personally asks you to work at one of the worst schools in the state, you say yes. I'm looking forward to bringing my brand of zany energy and lust -- not love, lust -- for learning to the underprivileged students at Malcolm X High. I welcome the challenge. The Teachers applaud, Scott the most enthusiastic. Elizabeth steps up to Amy, who flinches.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here, I got you this. Elizabeth hands Amy a poster tube. She.opens it and unravels the "Integrity" poster that Elizabeth stole.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And good luck. Somebody's gonna need it. Elizabeth heads for the door. Scott catches up to her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Stranger. (then, whispers) Listen, now that Amy's transferring, maybe the two of us could go grab a drink.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elizabeth walks out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elizabeth's 1994 Grand-Am pulls into her spot. And as her bare leg steps out of the car, we

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The hallway is empty. We FOLLOW Elizabeth from behind, and as she reaches for the door to her class, we

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Quick cuts. From behind, we see Elizabeth place an APPLE on each desk, just as Amy did earlier. Elizabeth's walls are still bare, except for a framed photo of Amy's class picture, with Amy's messed up face, from the year before. The bell RINGS. Elizabeth turns and we now SEE that she has TASTEFUL FAKE BREASTS. Elizabeth walks to her door and opens it, watching the students as they reconnect with friends and share stories about summer camp. She notices Sasha who is MASSAGING a BOY's shoulders. bunch of other EIGHTH GRADE BOYS wait their turn.

dialogues.speaker: EIGHTH GRADE BOY
dialogues.text: Do me! Do me! Sasha clearly enjoys the attention. Elizabeth smiles. Garrett walks by, hand in hand with Chase. Trailing both of them are identical rolling backpacks. He sees Elizabeth and runs over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You and Chase, huh? She likes the poetry?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She likes that I'm kind of a celebrity. But I'm cool with it. I'm the man around here!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Easy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I should get going. See you around, Ms. Halsey. Oh, and nice... He points at her breasts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks! You're the first student to notice. Garrett smiles and walks off. Lynn walks by. She's cleaning another big stain from her shirt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elizabeth, hey! How was your summer?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was great. I met a doctor! Plastic surgeon, actually. He's amazing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He sounds amazing. How'd you meet him? The internet?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, in recovery. And I looked like ass, so I know it's real.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sounds like a fairy tale.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is. Storybook. Well, not total storybook. It's a little messy because his wife filed for divorce last week, but we're gonna get through that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So you want to grab lunch later?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure! My treat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, you got it last time. We'll split it.
